description.text:
Role: Data Engineer
Seniority Level: Senior
 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
 Remote: Up to 40%
 Application Deadline: 08 June 2025
Assignment Overview
Join one of the largest data transformation journeys as a Senior Data Engineer. You will work with modern data platforms and build data products within a Data Mesh architecture to support a global data-driven organization.
Key Responsibilities
Develop, optimize, and support data products aligned with the defined target vision.
Take full ownership of data pipelines and infrastructure within GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
Build secure, scalable, observable, and performant data products as independently deployable units.
Collaborate with Product Managers and stakeholders to shape the roadmap for data products.
Work cross-functionally with other teams to implement Data Mesh principles.
Implement DevOps principles including CI/CD and infrastructure as code (Terraform).
Continuously evaluate and improve existing systems, reducing technical debt.
Stay current with latest trends in cloud, data engineering, and analytics.



Required Qualifications
Minimum 6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer.
At least 4+ years of hands-on experience with GCP or other modern cloud data platforms.
Proficient in GCP tools such as BigQuery, Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Experience with Parquet, Avro, and other data formats.
Strong SQL skills and programming experience in Python, Java, or Scala.
Good knowledge of data modeling, both NoSQL and RDBMS.
Experience in cloud infrastructure and DevOps workflows (CI/CD, Terraform).
Comfortable with data visualization tools and communicating data-driven insights.
Fluent in English, both written and verbal.
Advantage: Understanding of the retail industry and H&M business context.



Certification Requirement
GCP certification is mandatory.
If not already certified, the consultant must obtain the certification within 1 month of starting the assignment.



Additional Information
Candidates must be based in Sweden.
description.text_formatted:
Role: Data Engineer

Seniority Level: Senior

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Remote: Up to 40%

Application Deadline: 08 June 2025

Assignment Overview

Join one of the largest data transformation journeys as a Senior Data Engineer. You will work with modern data platforms and build data products within a Data Mesh architecture to support a global data-driven organization.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop, optimize, and support data products aligned with the defined target vision.
  • Take full ownership of data pipelines and infrastructure within GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
  • Build secure, scalable, observable, and performant data products as independently deployable units.
  • Collaborate with Product Managers and stakeholders to shape the roadmap for data products.
  • Work cross-functionally with other teams to implement Data Mesh principles.
  • Implement DevOps principles including CI/CD and infrastructure as code (Terraform).
  • Continuously evaluate and improve existing systems, reducing technical debt.
  • Stay current with latest trends in cloud, data engineering, and analytics.


Required Qualifications

  • Minimum 6+ years of experience as a Data Engineer.
  • At least 4+ years of hands-on experience with GCP or other modern cloud data platforms.
  • Proficient in GCP tools such as BigQuery, Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
  • Experience with Parquet, Avro, and other data formats.
  • Strong SQL skills and programming experience in Python, Java, or Scala.
  • Good knowledge of data modeling, both NoSQL and RDBMS.
  • Experience in cloud infrastructure and DevOps workflows (CI/CD, Terraform).
  • Comfortable with data visualization tools and communicating data-driven insights.
  • Fluent in English, both written and verbal.
  • Advantage: Understanding of the retail industry and H&M business context.


Certification Requirement

  • GCP certification is mandatory.
  • If not already certified, the consultant must obtain the certification within 1 month of starting the assignment.


Additional Information

  • Candidates must be based in Sweden.
